The food here was great! This was our first meal in Paris as it was close to our hotel. Luck find! We went back multiple times for quick meals and dessert. The sandwiches were great, the crepes were exceptional and we fell in love with the Nutella and ice cream crepe.
"Tom Cruise, Jr." is great- extremely friendly, fun and creative. He welcomed us in and chatted with us on the first visit and remembered us and details when we returned at a later date. And was friendly and entertaining to others eating as well.
Incredibly friendly and glad we found this place.
Very reasonable prices.
So fun sitting on the sidewalk enjoying the views.

We had finished exploring the Louvre and were looking for lunch. Since we exited onto Rue Rivoli, I figured there would be someplace we could find as the block seemed to be lined with shops and eateries. I whipped out Yelp and noticed that I had Happy Caffe bookmarked. I'm not sure how it landed in my collection, but the reviews were excellent thought it would be a good option for lunch - so off we went.

Happy sits right on the street - it's a super small space with barely any room inside and several tables outside on the sidewalk. They did a good job making room for us - I have to say they mastered the art of optimizing what little space they have but even still be prepared for a tight fit.

The menu has a selection of baked good, crepes, and sandwiches. We asked the employee working behind the counter what they recommended and he suggested the kebab panini as he sells many of them every day. We decided to each get one, which was served promptly.

The sandwich wasn't my favorite - the chicken seemed a little off, and it wasn't that tasty. I wouldn't say it was awful, but I also wouldn't order it again. Looking back, perhaps I ordered the wrong thing (despite it being recommended to me).

I'm puzzled by all these 5-star reviews - maybe the crepes are better? Two stars for the friendly and attentive service, but I would bypass this spot next time I'm in Paris.

For the price point and location on Rue de Rivoli, this place is alright. The servers are very friendly! My husband and I both had crepes and they were fine. The plates they serve them on are cute with the Eiffel Tower hand-drawn in mayo. The place itself is tiny but they have a few tables outside. It's not as cute of a setup as other places where you can "watch the world go by" but it's nice to sit outside to enjoy your meal (unless there are smokers just hanging around without regard for the diners, like there were when we were there).

Awesome food, awesome service!

I really wanted to get a crepe on our trip in Paris and figured I might as well check out Happy Caffe since it had great reviews. I ordered a sweet crepe with nutella, bananas, and strawberries with a freshly squeezed orange juice. My husband got a savory crepe with egg, ham, and cheese and a chocolate croissant. They make the crepes to order, so I watched him make ours! All the ingredients were very fresh. They even draw designs on the plates. Such as an Eiffel tower! My husband said he thinks it was the best crepe he has ever had, and I would agree with him! He also ordered a croissant to go. Their croissants are very good here!

Our server who really is the main guy running the place is very personable. He is super funny and engaging with his customers! Also, he was very thoughtful. He brought me a bag clip so that I could hang my purse off the table instead of putting it on the ground. Our server even gave us a chocolate pudding on the house! I will definitely remember him! The ratings of this place are really a true reflection on how impacting good service can be for a restaurant!

It is a pretty small restaurant and are not too many tables in the restaurant. We were able to sit inside.

Great location if you are going to the Louvre!

Stumbled upon this cafe and was happy with our food and especially our service. We had a few ham and cheese in a crossaint, which my son surpringly liked. I loved how it was served on a plate with a message. The staff was super friendly and that is the main reason they deserve five stars.

Loved it. We wanted baguettes and found this place. It's a tiny place on the sidewalk with outdoor seating. The server was pretty funny. The price is right. Around 8 euro for a baguette. Highly recommend.

My husband and I went to Happy Caffe on a cold and rainy day in January. It was cozy and warm in the small restaurant and the workers were so very kind and welcoming. We both got savory crepes and my husband got a sweet crepe afterwards. They were kind enough to give us recommendations and while the chef was making the crepes, we all discussed everything under the sun! I can't reiterate enough how friendly and hospitable everyone was. The crepes tasted phenomenal and I will definitely be coming back every visit to Paris from now on!!

I don't understand why this restaurant has a 5 star rating. The ambiance could not be less special. It's a tiny little restaurant. The food was not good. The coffee was not good. The service was not great. There are tons of fantastic places to eat in Paris (probably even on that block), I would not recommend this place.

I had the ham and cheese on a croissant and it was delicious. So good, in fact, that I came back later for another one. The staff are so kind and generous; they gave me a free glass of orange juice and some Biscoffs when I left. Most of the tables are outside though I managed to snag the one table inside both times and it was delightful. They have plenty of staff working and from what I could see food was served quickly and tables were bussed quickly also. It's in a great location! Very close to the Louvre and a nice park across the street. I highly recommend Happy Caffe!!
Great food. We shared a vegetarian crepe and "Oh my God" sandwich. Both were amazing! Reasonable pricing and the owner was great to talk too.
This tiny cafe was a hidden gem. Got a chicken Cesar and the chicken was amazing! Wait staff friendly & attentive.

Do you ever come across employees who are so engaging that you wish you could clone them and put them in every establishment you visit? That's what we found here in the Happy Caffé. Our guy (who called himself Tom Cruise) was so quick-witted and charming, he went out of his way to engage with everyone who walked in the door. For his Spanish customers he introduced himself as Antonio Banderas Jr. - lol. "Tom" kept us laughing the whole time with his banter and humor, not to mention excellent service. Our ham and cheese crepe and Nutella, strawberry and banana crepe were both good and came with the extra flourish of an Eiffel Tower drawing on the plate. My bottled apple juice was sooo good. Wish they'd sell that in the States! I might not say the crepes were five star but Happy Caffé lives up to its name - you leave there feeling five star happy and satisfied thanks to the staff. It's conveniently located near the Louvre and Tuileries Garden.
Quick seating for a small hole in the wall cafe! Has everything you want to eat in Paris! lol super quick ordering and close to monuments and stores!!
So much fun! This is a must stop cafe for crepes and cappuccinos. The staff is incredibly friendly.
Mr Tom Cruise is amazing! Great food, great service, and a nice little spot. And great prices too. Highly recommend.

Great tasting food & drink.
Super friendly and kind staff.
Good vibes while in Paris.
Great stop before heading into the Louvre.

Like others, our experience here was a standout on our five-country Europe trip. Truly, it was that positive. First, best crepe of my life (strawberry, banana and Caramel). The caramel sauce was crazy good.

Second, the main guy was personable, funny, kind and went out of his way to really connect with us. You really would want this to be how every food establishment treated its customers. They deserve their high rating.

Don't miss this experience. We went near closing and ordered right away. I heard there is a line during the day.
Cute little cafe! The staff are very friendly and accommodating. We had a larger party and they put tables up to accommodate us. The crepes were amazing! Will definitely be back!
Went here for a quick bite to eat, food was delicious. The owner took our order, and came to us multiple times to make sure we were taken care of. Made a couple jokes, and overall great experience!
Our favorite crepe place in Paris. Tom Cruise always takes excellent care of us. It's small place but one you must try.

Just dropped by for a cappuccino and croissant, it was awesome, the service was so fun, happy and welcoming
After ordered the croissant my husband had to try the ham and cheese croissant... so yummy

Stopped here while by the Lourve. The place is small, but the space is used efficiently. There are a few tables nearby to eat at if you want. Expect a wait if you are there around meal times. We waited about 20 minutes when we arrived at noon.

The two guys were very friendly and make the experience fun.... definitely a memorable service haha. I had a crepe with chicken, cheese, and egg and it was delicious and well seasoned. One portion is enough for a quick meal and the price was reasonable. Though they specialize in crepes (both sweet and savory), they also had sandwiches.

Would recommend it to those in the area!

This is an absolutely fantastic cafe and bakery. Tom Cruise was just so much fun and I couldn't wait to come back each time!

The ham, egg,and cheese (a little better than the chicken) were delicious as was the Nutella with banana and strawberries. I had my three daughter with me and the server was hysterical and sang to us and created works of art (the Eiffel Tower and the Mona Lisa) on our plates using bottles of ketchup and mayo. We had so much fun and the food was so good, we came back the next day!

I took my daughter to Paris this summer and this was our favorite spot! The people who work here are some of the kindest and most fun we've ever met at any restaurant, and the crepes are INCREDIBLE. We ended up going there for breakfast every day.

Do yourself a favor and check it out.

Being from South Texas, I get to eat a crepe about once every five years, so you know I'm no expert, but this little hole in the wall has the best I've ever experienced. However, an equally good reason to come here is to experience the wonderful and entertaining service provided by its Indian owner.

My ham, cheese, and tomato crepe was more than enough for me, but a bigger, younger person would be able to add a dessert crepe and be satiated.

Proximity to the Louvre makes this a perfect place to eat, and if you're lucky like we were to get a table immediately, it is the perfect meal.

Congratulations, Daddy, on your wonderful enterprise! We cherish our video of your performance.
Ham and cheese croissant was delicious! And the man who runs the cafe is genuinely one of the most positive and nicest human beings to exist! Highly recommend visiting
Antonio banderas jr was the best . Top notch service with excellent food , if you are around and looking for a bite to eat look no further .

Absolutely wonderful staff and food!
The people who run this spot are very welcoming and have plenty of conversation!
This was an amazing crepe spot and the guys who work there we beyond friendly and provided awesome service! My boys loved the atmosphere and we are so glad we stopped by for a break after the Louvre.
Cute little nook for a croissant and coffee with a lovely view of the park. Service was fast and very friendly.

The worker was very nice. He pretended to be Donald Trump because we were visiting from America it was very funny. The food was good and cheap, which was nice. Small indoor seating, so we took ours to go. Overall good quick meal.

Though not there entire fault they had no crepes as they were on auxiliary power due to street work which was told not enough to make crepes. The ham and cheese croissant I got okay. Not sure why they draw in mayo ant ketchup on plate. As does not go with item. Orange juice was not a full glass and maybe due to same power issue had no ice.
Wonderful spot for a nice brunch. Everyone was kind and patient (our French is virtually nonexistent lol), but they handled it well. The food was great and so were the drinks!

What a friendly group of people that work here! They really live up to their name. The food itself was flavored well, made fresh in front of your eyes. I got the egg and cheese, and my husband got the chicken crepe. Both were extremely delicious, hot (which was great for the freezing weather), and flavored/salted really well.

I'd go back in a heart beat!!!!
Great little sidewalk Cafe. The food & coffee ate fantastic. And the customer service is amazing!

-Happy Caffe in Paris, is located right across the street from the Tuileries Garden.

I think they are even nicer now than before. They made a delicious ham and cheese crepe. Looking forward to stopping in again before I leave.

It was a fun place to go. Very nice people and friendly. I had the ham and egg crepe, my wife had the strawberry and my son had donuts and Nutella crêpe.

First, the tragedy: the crepes were unavailable when we came. This was terrible, because literally everything else about this place was a delight. The sandwiches were great, the coffee was great, the pastries were great, the location was great, and the staff were outstanding and hilarious. We stopped here on our way out of town and are literally furious it wasn't something we did on day 1. It's making me hungry just thinking about it again. My son, who doesn't usually care about yelp, loudly declared when we left "Dad, make sure you give this place 5 stars!". He's never said that about any other place.

Great place. The servers are very welcoming and make your visit enjoyable. We had strawberry, banana Nutella crepe which was very good. I had the Kebab with cheese crepe which was awesome. Definitely a place to visit if you are in the area.
Delicious crepes, and good variety. I had the Nutella with strawberries and bananas. Outdoor seating and charming wait staff!

Where do I start... this place was awesome! My husband found this after a long morning at the Louvre and we wanted to get something quick. The food was great, but Christian "alias Tom Cruise", as he says, and his friend was even better... so friendly, engaging and welcoming! It didn't hurt that he complimented me on my French too!! This place lives up to its name indeed. I even went back to say hi one last time. He knows how to do business because it's not just the great food, great service, but the great relationships he builds that keep people coming back. He knows the special ingredient to a "happy cafe" indeed! Thank you for the wonderful experience! If I ever come back, I'm holding you hiring me because you said my French was really good!!! Thank you for the encouragement as I don't speak if that much. In the meantime, I'll keep working on my French so I can be a worthy hire in the future! Thank you!

We had just finished a 6 hour grueling tour of the louvre and were just the slightest bit hangry and ready to crawl out of the museum so we searched for cheap eats around this otherwise expensive area and came upon Happy Caffe. JUST what the doctor ordered. Full of filling sandwiches, DELICIOUS pastries (try the jelly donut bites and the almond croissant..heavenly!) and an assortment of drinks. The owner/shopkeeper is a jovial jokester who makes you feel right at home even if you don't speak French. PS he is fluent in English. Do yourself and your wallet a favor and stop by here for a yummy picnic to take to the gardens nearby.

By far, the best and affordable crepes near the Tulleries metro stop. We had both savory and sweet crepes and both were delicious. I chose the chicken and cheese and it was very good. Crispy burnt cheese and crepe on top, with a generous amount of filling throughout. This is a definitely a grab and go place, but you have a perfect sitting area in the park across the street. The owner is very nice, funny, and is an artisan of crepe making ...definitely worth the short wait for delicious and reasonably priced crepes! Highly recommend.

Excellent crepes. Most a takeaway place and you can just go the Tuillares garden.
Personally not a fan of crepes, but this was super to eat .
The two guys at the counter were also outgoing and funny. Good combination

I didnt want to come here at first because of the American name.... Im in France. BUT the chicken egg and cheese crepe was the best crepe I have ever had. The workers were extremely friendly and helpful. It is really a 10 out of 10. Also, the hot chocolate comes with the froth designs. First I have ever had that since I don't drink coffee. Soo, sooo good.

What a fun place to eat. Even though there are no tables and chairs, SO worth to come to this place. You could order some food and eat while on a walk or while sitting on a nearby bench.

The crepes were DELICIOUS! Not to mention, the service while making the crepes was fantastic. I would totally come back here again.

Visit this place for the crepes, visit again for the entertainment value. The shop itself is a good little convenience store, but the guy who made our order was high energy, funny, welcoming, and wonderful. He claimed to be Peter Parker (aka Spider-Man) but based on the other reviews, his name is probably Christian.
The crepes are amazing, and we returned the same day because they're just that super.
Happy Caffé has Excellent food and service. They are very happy and made lunch fun for the kids. The crepes were the best we had in Paris.

This place is awesome, the kabab chicken is wonderful and the man working who goes by "Tom Cruise" was hilarious and gave us great service after we learned he has been working there for 12 years. We really enjoyed the food. I would definitely recommend coming here if you are a tourist looking for a quick bite to eat for a sandwich or dessert!
Quintessential French crepes. My son ordered two! Great, friendly owner and fast service!
Wonderful crepes with a side of comedy. We loved this place. There are some seats outside and very convenient to The Louvre.

We happened upon the shop on a recommendation and were so happy that we did! What a nice person running the shop. No wonder they call it the happy cafe. He made fresh crepes right there and matched us with sandwiches. We had the 'Oh my God' sandwich, which was chicken cheese potatoes and sauce in a delicious half roll. It was home made and out of this world. The owner really makes you feel welcome. The prices are the best we found in the are too. Highly recommended

First night in Paris with my 12 year old and this guy made our day! He immediately stared laughing and joking with us and kept telling all the other customers that my daughter was his "best friend". She of course turned bright red and couldn't stop laughing. Crepes were great and "Peter Parker" was so funny.

Wow, amazing crepes. Had the chicken and cheese, hubby had the ham and cheese. All amazing and huge. You can definitely share unless you are famished. We then had Nutella and strawberry and my husband had the Nutella's and banana. These were all spectacular. Highly recommend and "Spider-Man" was really fun to talk with and kept us entertained while we waited. There is a wait because it's all made to order, but worth it! Don't miss this stop!

Stop in and ask for Christian! If your lucky....He will be there to greet you with a big smile and warm welcome. He will offer to fix you up with a "magical" espresso or a little something to go while making you laugh. Crepes are a must have!!!Because of Christian....The Happy Caffé became a daily routine stop during our unforgettable time in Paris.

Great place for a quick pastry or crepe. They understand English so that's always a good thing for non-French speakers. They also have a variety of drinks, coffee and sandwiches. They're conveniently located off of the Tulieries metro stop.

This place is great! It's small and you might miss it but it's worth finding. We had the jambon et fromage crepes. They were huge and delicious and had soo much cheese. We also got a bottle of rose which the owner uncorked and gave us two cups! It was great to get a crepe and go to the park afterwards. The owner is super friendly and he has regulars. He designed a cute design on our crepes before closing them up. The crepes were inexpensive as well! Well worth it! Check it out!

if you are seeing this please take my word, i am for some reason the one low star review and it is because the crepes aren't good. you can make them at home, literally €11 euros for a crepe with cheese or nutella, please please please just go somewhere else with actually good french crepes i am begging you. all the people who left these reviews are tourists who i don't think have actually ever had a actual FRENCH crepe. this is the stuff you can get in the US, the staff were nice but it didn't make up for the awful crepes!!!

This shop owner defines the personal touch. He spreads his joy right when you walk in and goes out of his way to make the simple experience of grabbing a bite to eat memorable. The shop itself is small but has plenty of delicious treats and snacks. We went for crepes (one sweet and one savory) and then went back for more. There aren't many places that are able to gain my loyalty from one visit on a trip abroad, but this is one of them. Every time I visit Paris I'll make a point to go to Happy Caffe.

A wonderful little café. The owner was so friendly and gave us many great suggestions. I will definitely go back. A refreshing dose of happiness. We had a ham and cheese crêpe and a bacon salad. Both were delicious topped by perfect café au lait. The owner did everything possible to make our little visit enjoyable. Overlooking the park you really couldn't ask for anything more on a spring day in Paris. Thank you Tom! Recommend!
Lovely owner, kind and funny ! Makes delicious crepes. Inexpensive and fresh. We had tomato cheese - he sliced the tomato freshly.
Friendly. Knows English. Great crepes! I would definitely recommend. Be sure have him write on your crape and take a pic.

As everyone knows, this guy is Spider-Man. He chatted us up the whole time we were there playing jokes telling funny stories and speaking to customers in different languages. We had to wait for 3 people in front of us but it was well worth it with entertainment. He had my son laughing and telling everyone that he was his best friend. He finally gave him an apple pie for free and told him he was not to share it with his dad. I had a chicken and cheese crepe the first day, then came back for a ham and cheese the next. The caramel doughnuts were awesome. Great little spot that wasn't expensive to grab on the go or while we stayed at the Westin down the street.
The man who works here is amazing. He is the nicest and friendliest person I have met in France. Very memorable. He boosted my mood instantly. Crepe was good and fresh, too!
Excellent! A fun and friendly staff, plus excellent service and food made our dining experience outstanding.

Me and my wife went in really early around 7:30am. The only place open. The guys was really friendly. He didn't like how the crepe looked and he made us another one before giving it to us. They sell soft drinks, wine, some liquor. Wine and liquor bottle to go. This place is open early and closes late. Amazing!! Definitely 5 stars.
The most amazing service I've ever received! Croissants and donuts were out of this world.
